author: Hoàng Mạnh Giỏi
title: Work on Hanoi’s VND 173-billion park project hastened | DTiNews - Dan Tri International, the news gateway of Vietnam
text: Work on Hanoi’s VND 173-billion park project hastened Hanoi is speeding up a park project with a total investment of VND173 billion (USD7.06 million) in Long Bien District. The project covers 57,752 square metres, including a park, a square and a balancing reservoir, a system of playgrounds and sports areas equipped with outdoor exercise equipment, walking paths, parking lots, flower gardens and fountains. The lack of public and recreational spaces for residents has always been a burning issue in Hanoi. The city plans to invest VND15.08 trillion (USD612 million) in upgrading 30 local parks in the 2024-2026 period. Of this sum, VND408 billion will be used to renovate Thong Nhat Park. Thu Le Park and Hanoi Botanical Garden will receive VND330 billion and VND149 billion, respectively. The project covers 57,752 square metres, including a park, a square and a balancing reservoir, a system of playgrounds and sports areas equipped with outdoor exercise equipment, walking paths, parking lots, flower gardens and fountains. Work on the project was started last year and is scheduled to be finished in 2026. Many cranes and specialised vehicles have been mobilised for the project’s implementation, and some of its facilities are gradually taking shape. Once completed, the project will provide more public spaces for people to relax. The lack of public and recreational spaces for residents has always been a burning issue in Hanoi. The city plans to invest VND15.08 trillion (USD612 million) in upgrading 30 local parks in the 2024-2026 period. Of this sum, VND408 billion will be used to renovate Thong Nhat Park. Thu Le Park and Hanoi Botanical Garden will receive VND330 billion and VND149 billion, respectively.
